projectGridLines.title: TCAD/Silvaco-based modeling of GaN HEMTs for RF & power electronics
projectGridLines.description:
Description: For guiding experimental work as well as for generating new IP, we use TCAD (Silvaco) based device simulation to study, understand and design novel and/or high-performance GaN HEMTs. Energy band diagram, DC characteristics, field profile, RF and pulsed I-V behavior of GaN transistors are to be simulated and benchmarked against experimental data in this project.

Skill sets: Strong background in semiconductor devices and device physics. Familiarity with TCAD is desirable.  

Traits expectation: Ability to drive the project and exhibit leadership on the ground.

Expected learning: Complete understand of GaN HEMTs for RF/power electronics including simulation of the same.

Specific courses required for project execution: Semiconductor devices/device physics

projectGridLines.title: High temperature Operating lifetime (HTOL) tests of high-power GaN RF transistors
projectGridLines.description:
Description: To help develop a testing platform to perform reliability tests of high power GaN RF devices, especially HTOL tests.

To perform HTOL tests, analyze data, estimate lifetime and give feedback to process & design team.

Requires hands on working with power supplies, PCB design, source meters, relays & switches, etc. Requires interfacing with packaging team on wire bonding, die attach etc.

Skill sets: Some hands-on experience with test benches and electrical measurements is highly desirable.

Traits expectation: Ability to drive the project and exhibit leadership on the ground, ability to interface with people.

Expected learning: Extensive electrical measurement tests especially for device reliability and the ability to design, develop testing setups.

Specific courses required for project execution: Semiconductor devices, electrical measurements
